extendedInfo.description: Now currently available for STARZÂ® subscribers through AT&T U-verseÂ®, Atlantic BroadbandÂ®, Bright House NetworksÂ®, Time Warner CableÂ®, CoxÂ® cable, Grande CommunicationsÂ®, DIRECTVÂ®, Verizon FiOSÂ®, GCI, and OptimumÂ® only. More television providers coming soon.Your STARZ subscription just got better. Now you can watch fiercely entertaining originals as well as hit movies anywhere you go. You can play episodes of past season original series as well as current season episodes the day after they premiere on STARZ. Plus, get immediate access to hit movies right when you want to watch them. STARZ Play gives you maximum user control by letting you play, pause and rewind. You can stop watching a movie or show and resume it, right from where you left off, whenever and wherever you want. Plus, itâs available on multiple devices.  Start it on your home computer, pick it up on the phone, and finish on a tablet.  Best of all, STARZ Play is FREE with your STARZ subscription.  STARZ Play is only accessible in the U.S. and certain U.S. territories and requires a high speed broadband connection (a minimum 3G connection is required to use on an authorized mobile device).  The Play services are included with a subscription through participating cable, satellite and telco television providers. STARZ and related service marks are the property of Starz Entertainment, LLC.

reviews.title: Crashes at playback start
reviews.comment: Works on my rooted HTC Vision running Android 4.2.2 so I thought I\'d try it on my new Nexus 7 (2013) device. It starts, allows my to log in with my FiOS account, see my bookmarked playlist, and browse the catalog but when I attempt to play title it crashes.
reviews.author: Scott Rynd

reviews.title: Rooted?
reviews.comment: Are you kidding me? Telling me my phone is rooted and I can\'t use the app? First off its absolutely not rooted and 2nd, why the hell would you care?
reviews.author: Peter Bosader

reviews.title: Samsung Galaxy Tab 2 and S3
reviews.comment: It starts to play a movie and then the whole device shuts down and restarts.  Im gonna uninstall from both devices until this issue is fixed.
reviews.author: tiketa miles

reviews.title: Nice looking app...
reviews.comment: Good use of hdmi mirroring.   Loses a point for not having watchlists.   (Would also be nice if I didn\'t have to sign in constantly. HBO Go stays logged in for weeks,  if not forever.)
reviews.author: T Boogy

reviews.title: Won\'t work on rooted tablets????
reviews.comment: Your app is worthless if it won\'t work on rooted tablets. I dropped HBO for Starz and this is what I get?  Perhaps I will switch back, HBO Go doesn\'t care if I\'m rooted.
reviews.author: Bill Nist

reviews.title: Poor app
reviews.comment: Says I\'m not authorized to use this app when I\'m a TWC customer and I am able to use HBOgo app!  LOL @ Starz, what a joke.
reviews.author: Brett Crouch

reviews.title: Garbage. Will not play on HTC ONE
reviews.comment: My phone is not rooted the app says it is. Please fix the app.
reviews.author: Chris Gorham

reviews.comment: Would be nice if I could play a title on my galaxy tab2 without the selection playing a few minutes and then crashing, then restarting my tablet wtf
reviews.author: Matthew Tillis

reviews.title: End of the road
reviews.comment: Great app, however I will have to uninstall and drop Starz since Magic City will end its course this Friday. No Magic City = no Starz.
reviews.author: JOHNNY CERDA

reviews.comment: Add dish to your list of providers please....dying to watch boss!!
reviews.author: Lisa Carbonara

reviews.title: Not working with root.
reviews.comment: Does not work if your rooted. Sad :(
reviews.author: Christopher Jimenez

reviews.title: NO DISH
reviews.comment: Why do they Have Directv and No Dish. When it first came out I was able to log in. Now will not work. Please add Dish. STARZ is the best channel
reviews.author: Kenny Simmons

reviews.comment: Crashed on play request, browse is fine but will not play, was fine before upgrade to 1.0.2\tCrashes on play was fine before upgrade to 1.0.2 on zoom tablet. Now,it will not play any starz content. Nice upgrade guys, great job......
reviews.author: Christopher Mckenney

reviews.title: Cuts out after 5 min
reviews.comment: Video stops and returns to main screen after 5 minutes of streaming.  Cannot watch a movie/episode without interruption.
reviews.author: Tomas Ortiz

reviews.title: Galaxy note 2
reviews.comment: Any time I am watching something then get a text message it restarts my phone. Don\'t have this issue with hbo go, Netflix, hulu or any other streaming apps other than starz and encore.
reviews.author: Carlton Wheatley

reviews.title: Rooted
reviews.comment: This sucks. I love starzs so I figured the app would be good. Its has good movies available. But when I go to watch a movie it tells me that my device is rooted. I would give this app 5 but I haven\'t even been able to use it. So please starz fix this and I\'ll give you 5 stars.
reviews.author: Alicia Adkins

reviews.title: Listen to your subscribers!
reviews.comment: The rooted restriction is ridiculous. It\'s my device. Not to mention I can watch Starz programming using the FIOS app.
reviews.author: Scott Rudy

reviews.title: Doesn\'t work at all!
reviews.comment: Downloaded the app while on vacation and it didn\'t work. Figured it might have been the network but when I got back  to NY the app still doesn\'t work. Keeps on saying cannot connect to server when all of my other applications work flawlessly. Even third party anime apps work better than this. Huge disappointment.
reviews.author: Ricardo Serrano

reviews.title: Crashes
reviews.comment: Everytime i watch a movie or a show it crashes and starts over. Not worth keeping this app if it does that all the time. Does that on my android tablet and iphone app.  I noticed that i need silverlight to watch statzplay on the website, is that why i cant view it on the app too?
reviews.author: MICHAEL BEUZIERON

reviews.title: Punishment because of root
reviews.comment: Blocked because the device is rooted. This is absurd!
reviews.author: Patrick Johnston
